ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 15 hours per week
5h
2 hours
5 hours
6 hours
3 hours on average

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The structure of the course is messy. The lecture notes are not perfectly formatted. Homework assignments are not consistent.
Useful contents. Well-organized.
This course is not helpful and has a lot of repititive material of other courses.

Totally a waste of time for students not interested in consulting. It shouldn't be a required course for biostatistic major students. Clearly only few students would love to pay attention to this course.
This course is an applied course, having some overlap of knowledge in other courses
This course helps us build up our ability to deal with real-world statistical analysis work, including both technical and communicating aspects.
Useful class
Disorganized
I hope the structure of this course could be more organized

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Denise Esserman  Good lecture notes
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Great at explaining and asking questions.
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Dr. Esserman is very devoted and patient.
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Dr. Esserman is humorous, and professional.
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Overall good.
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Dr. Esserman gives interesting lectures and is accessible in or after class.
Instructor: Denise Esserman  Very nice instructor!
Instructor: Denise Esserman  I really like Dr. Esserman and I appreciate her help!
Instructor: James David Dziura  Lecturing is pretty boring.
Instructor: James David Dziura  Great at explaining and examples.
Instructor: James David Dziura  Dr. Dziura is very helpful and responsive.
Instructor: James David Dziura  He is really kind and responsible.
Instructor: James David Dziura  Overall good.
Instructor: James David Dziura  The lectures on bias and some other topics prepared by Dr. Dziura provide helpful tips in real-world statistical analysis.
Instructor: James David Dziura  Very nice instructor!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Not very helpful. The materials are overlapped with the other courses. The course structure is messy.
refresh and apply what you learned.
Interesting topics and format. I would recommended it.
Not recommend.
It is required.
A course focusing on the application of statistical analysis skills. I would recommend it to students who are interested in empirical topics in statistics, especially statistical consulting.
Useful class!
I'd like to recommend it to others. It's helpful.
This is, unfortunately, a required course.
